FuncDef:
The login-user sftp-directory command configures the user name and SFTP directory on the master for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
The undo login-user sftp-directory command deletes the user name and SFTP directory on the master for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
By default, no user name or SFTP directory for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master is configured on the master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the user name for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the SFTP directory for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
The wildcard "#" cannot be used. The value is a character string in the format of [ drive ][ path ]. An absolute path name is a string of 1 to 255 characters. A relative path name is a string of 1 to 128 characters. Up to 8 levels of directories are supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the user name and SFTP directory on the master for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master, run the login-user sftp-directory command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
